pydra.core.protocol module¶

class pydra.core.protocol.Protocol(name, repetitions, interval)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtCore.QObject

Class for creating and running protocols.

Protocols are a queued sequence of events, timers and triggers. Events can be any callable method or function, timers introduce waits within the protocol, and triggers allow external triggers to be received before continuing. Protocols also allow for a “free-running mode”, which will cause the protocol to run continuously until interrupted.

Protocols may be repeated any number of times with a time gap in between repetitions.

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the protocol.

  • repetitions (int) – Number of times protocol is to be repeated.

  • interval (float) – Time between repetitions of the protocol.

event_queue¶

A list of events, timers and triggers within the protocol.

Type

list

rep¶

The current repetition number.

Type

int

timer¶

Timer for controlling interval between repetitions.

Type

QtCore.QTimer

flag¶

Internal flag for whether the protocol is currently running (includes repetitions and inter-rep intervals).

Type

bool

Notes

The event queue is a list of Queued, Timer and TriggerContainer objects. These objects all implement a __call__ method and contain a “finished” Qt signal. The finished signal of each object connect to the __call__ method of the next object in the event queue.

  • For Queued object, the finished signal emits as soon as the queued method returns.

  • For Timer objects, the finished signal emits after a predefined elapsed time.

  • For TriggerContainer objects, the finished signal emits when the Trigger object emits its triggered signal.

The free-running mode implements a special case of a TriggerContainer, whereby a trigger is never received and so a finished signal is never emitted.

addEvent(method: callable, *args, **kwargs) → None[source]¶

Add an event to the protocol.

Parameters

  • method (callable) – Any object that implements a __call__ method.

  • args (iterable) – Arguments passed to method when called.

  • kwargs (dict) – Keyword arguments passed to method when called.

addTimer(msec: int) → None[source]¶

Add a timer to the protocol.

Parameters

msec (int) – The duration of the timer (in milliseconds).

addTrigger(trigger: pydra.core.protocol.trigger.Trigger) → None[source]¶

Add a timer to the protocol.

Parameters

trigger (Trigger) – A Trigger object.

classmethod build(name: str, reps: int, interval: int, events: list, freerun: bool = False, interrupt: Optional[callable] = None)[source]¶

Builds a protocol object from a list of events.

clearFlag()[source]¶

Clears the flag. Internal use only.

completed¶
end()[source]¶

Called at the end of a repetition of the protocol.

finished¶
freeRunningMode()[source]¶

Cause protocol to enter free-running mode. No events, timers or triggers can be called after protocol enters free-running mode.

interrupt()[source]¶

Interrupts the protocol.

interrupted¶
running()[source]¶

Returns whether the protocol is running (includes repetitions and inter-rep intervals).

setFlag()[source]¶

Sets the flag. Internal use only.

setInterval(sec)[source]¶

Can be used to reset the interval.

setRepetitions(n)[source]¶

Can be used to reset the number of repetitions.

start()[source]¶

Called to start one repetition of the protocol.

started¶
